CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 7, 1953, pg. 2 reads: " 'Held for Federal Court - Alleged "pushers" and "junkies" nabbed during the recent Hill District narcotics dragnet found the going quite rough before United States Commissioner Harold Lavine last week and this week as they appeared before him on charges of having sold "junk" to Federal undercover agents. The agents' testimony included time, place, amount of dope and identification of the "pushers."  After discovering who one of the undercover agents was, some of the suspects plead guilty.  The rest were held for court on the basis of the damaging testimony and heavy bonds were imposed...William R. Lewis and Gwendolyn Benns chat while waiting for their hearings on similar charges of having sold dope to an undercover agent.  Lewis was later held for court under $7,500 bond, and defendant Benns, under $5,000 bond.-Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: William R. Lewis wearing light colored suit and medallion patterned tie, seated next to Gwendolyn Benns awaiting arraignment on narcotics charges in Pittsburgh Federal Courthouse
